name: cracked

cracked adjective
(DAMAGED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is cracked, it is damaged with one or more thin lines on its surface: a cracked mirror/window cracked plates
More examplesFewer examplesThere was a cracked mirror on the table.The wall was badly cracked.X-rays showed he had a cracked vertebra.He smiled, showing a cracked tooth.

cracked adjective
(MENTAL HEALTH)
informal offensive an offensive word to describe someone who has a mental health condition, or who does not behave in a reasonable way : The neighbours thought he was cracked.
informal silly or stupid: In my opinion, that's a totally cracked idea.
More examplesFewer examplesLet us drop the nonsense about Joan of Arc being cracked, and accept her as at least as sane as Florence Nightingale. Some of William Blake's poetry is completely cracked."You 're cracked," she says. If only I was they could lock me up somewhere quiet and take care of me.She's a true original, a cracked fabulist.Maybe this is his cracked idea of a joke.
